google_play_reviews.content: Finally a simple, ad free and RELIABLE app to send messages through voip! Thank you so much

google_play_reviews.content: Works great. My only suggestion is to add support for MMS. If this isn't possible how about some sort of message letting you know to login to the portal to view the MMS message?

google_play_reviews.content: Very handy for quick access to and deleting texts on multiple numbers

google_play_reviews.content: Apps works great, but it would be amazing if we could send/receive picture

google_play_reviews.content: Easy to use, simple and reliable. Perfect!

google_play_reviews.content: No longer reliably sends and receives SMS.

google_play_reviews.content: Really useful. No nonsense. Does everything I need it to do. Very happy. Thank you!!!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the review!

google_play_reviews.content: Have to say that I enjoy the app, but it keeps getting stuck on sending and never notifies me if the message sends or not. I've had a couple of important messages not send when I need them to. I understand this is something being worked on but this is a pretty bad bug imo Edit: Reducing my score because it still gets stuck on sending a year later. I keep getting important messages not sent
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Sorry to hear you're having trouble!

google_play_reviews.content: I downgraded my review from 5 stars to 2 stars because this app doesn't support MMS, if someone sends you a picture you will not even know unless you have it sent to your email. I switched to textable an app that supports MMS on VoIP.ms it costs $5 a month but it's worth it since the MMS messages work perfectly.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: 0.6.24 will include limited support for receiving MMS messages.

google_play_reviews.content: Very easy to use. Finally a way to read and respond to texts to my Windows VoIP phone on my Android!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the review!

google_play_reviews.content: I have been using this app for a few months now and really enjoy it because it acts and 'feels' much like the Google Message app. I would give it 5 stars if I could send / recieve MMS (pics, gifs) with my text as well. To developer.. could you make a VoIP.ms SIP phone app and make it 'feel' like the Google Phone app? I would probably pay $5 for that app. Keep up great work!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: 0.6.24 will include limited support for receiving MMS messages.

google_play_reviews.content: App no longer sends Longer / Multi Part Text Messages in Sequence, or Truncates messages correctly. How hard would it be for the Developer to count characters up until the limit and create a Message break at the first space character before the limit. Yes, the App is free, but if the Developer doesn't have the minimum programming skills to do an adequate job, maybe the Source Code could be donated so a component programmer can take over.
Continually amazed by how good this app is. It just works. Way better then zoiper for sms
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the review!

google_play_reviews.content: Excellent app for use with the voip.ms service, sms feature. I would like to see the ability for those with more than one DID number, (for example each family member has their own DID) to have the app only show a specific number. Currently it will list all numbers and you toggle off the ones you do not wish to use. However any member could simply turn the other number back on and intercept their sms messages.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
It looks like I can reproduce the push notification issue -- will look into it.

I cannot reproduce the synchronization timer issue.

google_play_reviews.content: I have several DIDs with VoIP ms that support MMS picture and audio messaging as well, however this app doesn't support displaying those or letting you send them which is a disappointment, but besides that it works amazing!
gabelechuga

Probably the best app to use with voip.ms SMS! My only grief is mainly caused by the 160 character limit set by voip.ms but can be (slightly) mitigated with this app. When my message gets chopped up into separate SMS messages, the order they are sent is sometimes wrong. Is this something this app could fix by having a time delay between "chopped" messages? Also - a secondary feature that would be nice is that it does not "chop" a word in the middle, but rather go back to the last "space" so that the messages are easier to read. Those two features would turn this into a 5 start perfect app in my opinion!

Works pretty well, but with a big caveat: It's not possible to receive emojis at all. You can send them, but if someone tries to send you a message with emojis, they get stripped out. If someone sends you a message with ONLY emojis, they get an error telling them the message was undeliverable!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Unfortunately, that's a VoIP.ms issue -- you'll have to take it up with them! There's nothing I can do to fix it, unfortunately.

google_play_reviews.content: Easy to use, perfect. I wish there was a clean and easy app for voice calls. Michael? :)
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Ha! Very different problem to solve... Thanks for the review!

google_play_reviews.content: It works great. I'm just wondering if there is away to send/receive MMS?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the review! MMS support is coming eventually.

google_play_reviews.content: This app is far more reliable than groundwire. Groundwire has a 98% delivery rate but obviously thats unacceptable as missing just one text could be a major problem. I seem to have 100% delivery rate with this app! Rated 4 stars simply because there's no MMS ability. I will bump it to 5 stars if that ever gets added.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the review! MMS support is coming eventually.

google_play_reviews.content: Great app, works well.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the review!

google_play_reviews.content: Fabulous app but needs some customization. I'm used to Textra which is the king of customization. One major thing I'd like to see added is the ability to (selectively per contact) prevent the name and/or message content from being part of the notification. This is just a great app for use for voip.ms and eons better than any soft phone app's integrated messenger. I'd happily pay a few bucks to help you fund the growth of this app or help inspire a premium version with more features. Thanks!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the review!

google_play_reviews.content: Best app for sms with VoIP.ms. Very reliable.

google_play_reviews.content: Baller app. Handles voip.ms SMS wonderfully.

google_play_reviews.content: Wow!! A reliable and light sms app for voip.ms? Please and thank you! Glad I stumbled on this, works flawlessly. Looking for MMS support though, would be really nice to have that. feature
google_play_reviews.replyContent: I do intend to add MMS support eventually. Thanks for the review!

google_play_reviews.content: The app has been improved quite well.. I can effectively use it as with incoming as with outgoing messages.. Recommended..

google_play_reviews.content: Pretty darn good! Will be 5 stars when it supports sending photo attachments! I can't see photos people send me. Otherwise it's awesome! Thank you!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: I do eventually intend to add MMS support. Thanks for the review!

google_play_reviews.content: Just installed this app to replace Zoiper's SMS. Looks to be much more reliable. Right now Zoiper is getting "registration failed", likely due to DDoS, but this app is working great. The best feature here is that you can set a start date so that it will populate the message database with some old messages so you don't feel you're starting with a clean slate. Unless there's a problem, this will now be my default SMS app.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the review!

google_play_reviews.content: Prompt response. Excellent service.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: The VoIP.ms API is still down. You can give this app a one star rating if you want, but it won't make VoIP.ms restore their API any faster.

google_play_reviews.content: Working well.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the review!

google_play_reviews.content: Great little app for those of us who prefer to use VoIP.ms and looking forward to adding MMS. However, as of Sept. 13/21 and it seems due to a DDoS attack currently underway.... the SMS app can no longer find voip.ms when you try and setup the app account. Any guidance correcting this issue would be appreciated.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Unfortunately we're all stuck until VoIP.ms recovers.

google_play_reviews.content: Much more reliable then zoiper . I have 2 requests. First : When I send a message, if I minimize the app before the app has finalized sending the message. The message will never send and just say sending forever, or it will fail but still won't be able to send when you hit retry. Is this something that can be fixed? Second: Now that MMS is working and in the API docs has commands to send and receive them. Would you be able to intragrate this into the app?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the review! The first point is a known issue which I am looking into. I do intend to eventually add MMS support.

google_play_reviews.content: My favorite
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the review.

google_play_reviews.content: So I came here to leave a 3 star review due to some issues I was having that Phillip mentioned about sms's jamming in a "sending" state. If it gets stuck in sending, you never are notified, and in the last week I've managed to tick off about 3 people so far. However, the very ignorant, immature & wrongful 1 star review from j * gave me perspective. Overall, developer. Thank you. I am very grateful for your work, and if he wants to rate you 1 star with his reasoning, 5 stars all the way for me!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the review! That's a known issue which I am looking into.

google_play_reviews.content: great app! if you could make this for telnyx, you would be a hero!

google_play_reviews.content: This is scam give it a 1 star so google delete it
google_play_reviews.replyContent: No, it isn't a scam. What's your problem?

google_play_reviews.content: Very fast for SMS on VoIP.ms. Great app.

google_play_reviews.content: Hugo Bhutto nunu beach mutiny

google_play_reviews.content: Paid money. Spent half the day trying to simply send a text from tablet. Said it easy. Finally got it set up. Then I get to this (DiD) B.S. Finally gave up. $15.00 in credit for something that is absolutley NOT easy to use in fact impossible. Not gonna let some bully tell me I cant leave 1 star. Im done. Keep my money. Anothr half day to get it back im sure. Forget it!! ......... WELL I GUESS YOU SHOULD BE ANGRY AT THEM FOR MAKING MONEY FROM THIS FAKE APP. . SO MANY OBVIOUS FAKE REVIEWS
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
This app is entirely free of charge and is not developed or maintained by VoIP.ms. I'm just a software developer who does this in my spare time.

I'm sorry to hear you're having issues, but I think you're directing your anger at the wrong person.

google_play_reviews.content: Excellent app. At the beginning, I had to open the app each time to see whether I had any new texts, but a couple of weeks ago the app got updated a few times in a matter of days and now new text messages are pushed automatically to my phone, even when I'm not using the app. Thank you so much!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Glad you like the app!

google_play_reviews.content: Can I block the number that send scam message?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Although the app doesn't yet support a blocklist, you can probably do that using VoIP.ms directly.

google_play_reviews.content: Works just fine sending and receiving txt messages.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the review!

google_play_reviews.content: The only usable app for VoIP messaging. GS Wave & Port SIP had terrible UIs and failed to consistently deliver messages and also did not show contact names, unlike this app. My only issue with this app is not being able to import old messages from the native android messenger. Please add that feature and it would be perfect. Also if there is anyway to donate to you for your hard work, I would love to do so, thank you Michael.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
It's unlikely I'll ever add a feature to import messages from the Android SMS database due to the work involved, unfortunately.

I'm glad you like the app, though!

google_play_reviews.content: Follow the dev's instructions and this app works great. I had to manually enter the callback to get notifications, but that doesn't detract from my 5 stars. Makes my life much simpler. Thank you for building this app!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the review!

google_play_reviews.content: Is there a way to support multiple logins? I have a business account and personal account but can only login to one. Good otherwise.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Unfortunately, the app doesn't support multiple logins at this time.

google_play_reviews.content: For a basic sms app for my voip.ms DID's it works great.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the review!

google_play_reviews.content: Great app! Please update to support voip.ms MMS (now available) and it will be flawless!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: I will be adding support for MMS eventually.

google_play_reviews.content: Recycled change log. Update: Would it have killed you to put up the relevant information? It took you longer to reply to me than it would have to do it in the first place. My phone is my phone. I want to know what is going on. Period. Reply to dev: as opposed to the devs "nagging" for 5 star reviews even though the app is far from perfect. Talking in general, not you specifically.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
I've noted in the Google changelog that 0.6.3-4 were bugfix releases. It's better to be more precise, even though the 0.6.2 changelog already said "Bug fixes" and the full changelog is on GitHub.

I think your aggressive, ungrateful 1-star review is a totally unreasonable response to this issue, especially since this is a free and open source app.

google_play_reviews.content: Very good app. however i wish i could set it as the default sms app in android.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: So do I, but Android won't let me offer that feature. Default SMS apps also have to support standard carrier SMS, and my app does not.

google_play_reviews.content: Sms texts come in late. Sometimes on time but many times days later !
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Please try disabling battery optimizations for the app.

google_play_reviews.content: Now that VoIP.ms supports MMS I'm hoping for some sort of integration. Still an awesome app.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: It's on my to-do list.

google_play_reviews.content: Excellent app for voip.ms Thank you for making and supporting it. I am anticipating the update to support MMS. Im sure it will be great too.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: MMS is on my to-do list.

google_play_reviews.content: Love the app! Please allow for the new MMS feature!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: MMS is on my to-do list.

google_play_reviews.content: Has been Great for years. Hope you add their MMS feature next.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: MMS is on my to-do list.

google_play_reviews.content: I was super excited to discover this app. It's a must have if you are using sms on your VoIP.ms account.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: This was caused by a couple of issues both on VoIP.ms's end and in my app, which should all be fixed in the next release.

google_play_reviews.content: I love this app, it looks great and it's free. The only issue I have is when multiple messages come through at once (split because over character length) they don't show up in the right order (which can be a little confusing). <<>> - I did notice when they are all received at in the message details the ID is correct in ascending order, but the app always has them in reverse. Sorting by this number if the timestamp was the same could potentially work if it's available to you.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: That is a good point, and something I hadn't noticed before. I will sort messages with the same timestamp by VoIP.ms ID in the next release, which may fix this ordering problem in many cases.

google_play_reviews.content: All good! Messages still come in out of order though. Have to jump back and forth between long messages. Oh and I know you can't send or receive images with this but could you somehow indicate that someone tried to send one to you?
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Some updates -- it looks like I might be able to use the VoIP.ms ID to order messages correctly; this will be fixed in the next release.

In addition, VoIP.ms has at last added MMS support to their API, so once I get that working I will be able to add MMS support to the app.

google_play_reviews.content: For Push notifications to work, make sure you follow the instructions for the URL Callback settings!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Definitely -- I wish things could be easier to set up, but there's only so much the app can do!

google_play_reviews.content: I've been using this app for a couple of years and it's been great. There has been an issue for the last couple of months though with syncing new messages. Like some other reviewers have stated, seems push notifications are not coming through. Any ideas? Might be related to the recent slew of android updates.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: I think the quotas I set for the relay server were too low. Hopefully this is now fixed.

google_play_reviews.content: Great. Thank you, Michael!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the review!

google_play_reviews.content: Best app for VoIP.ms SMS
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the feedback!

google_play_reviews.content: Very good application for VoIP.ms. I like it. Thank you.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Glad you like the app!

google_play_reviews.content: Looks like a good app but I can't get it to work for some reason.. I have sms enabled, and logging in to this app enabled sip url callback to the proper url it looks like but I get sms failed whenever I try to send an SMS.. not sure if it's the app or VoIP.ms. Edit: fixed, it was an issue on VoIP.ms' end
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Glad the problem was fixed!

google_play_reviews.content: Love everyrhing about this app ecept one thing. Some times it sends my reply 3 times. Not sure why but as a bussines owner it can look unprofesional when i reply to a cusromer 3 times.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Are you pressing the send button more than once? If not, it's probably an issue on VoIP.ms's end.

google_play_reviews.content: This app is the best way to do SMS when using VoIP.ms. The ability to set this as the default Android SMS app would be appreciated.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Unfortunately, that's not possible because the app doesn't support carrier SMS.

google_play_reviews.content: Works great! I briefly inspected the code and saw no problems. When voip.ms releases MMS it will be even better than carrier SMS minus the obvious issues with UDH concatenation or encoding.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Glad you like the app! :)

google_play_reviews.content: I really love this app, but i don't run the most recent build simple because I hate the new color choices. Could we at least get to choose the background color for messages?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: I will be adding support for a dark theme in the next release. Hopefully the colours will be more to your liking!

google_play_reviews.content: Works just like a regular sms app. 5 stars if there is a unified view for all numbers.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: That's on my to-do list.

google_play_reviews.content: I love the app. Anyway to donate other than PayPal? I'd love to send some money, but their .99 fee is ridiculous. OpenCollective would be great.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Unfortunately, no, not at this time.

google_play_reviews.content: First, I must say I really like this app. The problem that I indicate has only started in the last while. My phone no longer receives incoming SMS messages when the are sent to the phone. Let me clarify, unless I specifically have the app open in the forefront, I see nothing Does not download them in the background even with 5-minute synchronization strange Updated to the latest version and still nothing....
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Unfortunately, I can't reproduce this problem on my device. You shouldn't have to enable synchronization to receive messages -- you should be receiving push notifications using Google's infrastructure.

google_play_reviews.content: Not working in pakistan any solution
google_play_reviews.replyContent: You'll have to contact VoIP.ms.

google_play_reviews.content: Excellent SMS app and easy to get started. Outgoing messages seems to be a bit delayed, but incoming is pretty much instant. Need a phone version of this...
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Glad you like the app. :)

google_play_reviews.content: nice app very usefull
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Glad you like the app. :)

google_play_reviews.content: Great app, and works as expected. Thank you very much!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Glad you like the app. :)

google_play_reviews.content: This app was the deciding factor on whether I would switch to VoIP.ms or not. I can use this with a data-only plan and have nearly the same experience I would texting through a carrier. There are some quirks because of VoIP.ms limitations, like how large messages are split up and out of order, but they're manageable. Edit: removed feature request because I just saw on your GitHub page that VoIP.ms is working on MMS. Exciting stuff!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Glad you like the app. :)

google_play_reviews.content: clean simple no fault alternative sms to cell-phones from - your choice of tablet or other non cell ( or cell) android device with potential advantages of blue tooth keyboard for faster typing, plus privacy element of 2nd non cell msngr, plus $$ savings vs. some data plans. push feature a hugeb plus!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Glad you like the app. :)

google_play_reviews.content: Lightweight, no ads, no hidden fees, fast, open source, clean user interface. Super.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Glad you like the app. :)

google_play_reviews.content: Love the app! It works great and it's very useful.  I would like to offer a couple of suggestions to improve it even more:  - When selecting a contact that has multiple phone numbers, the window that pops up to select the correct number to use should indicate each number's description (i.e. "mobile", "home", "work", etc.)  - I don't know if that's possible due to the app not using the SIM card for SMS but it would be awesome if it could be registered as an actual SMS app with Android so that it could be selected as the default SMS app. This way other apps that integrate with SMS functionality could use it instead of Google Messages.  Thanks for developing this app and keep up the great work!
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
The first suggestion is on my to-do list. 

Unfortunately, the second suggestion isn't possible for the reason you suspected -- the app doesn't support carrier SMS. I wish it were!

Thanks for the five star review!

google_play_reviews.content: Great app and love the fact that author made it open source. One feature I would LOVE to have is dial contacts using DISA PIN feature of voip.ms. The feature is similar to how calling card apps work - you dial your own voip number, pass in DISA PIN and then the contact to call.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the feedback! Unfortunately it's very unlikely that this app will ever support using VoIP.ms to make phone calls. This kind of feature would be better for a VoIP dialer like Zoiper.

google_play_reviews.content: Work perfect
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your feedback!

google_play_reviews.content: awesome app. would it be possible to limit outs access to a single phone number when you have multiple? thanks
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the feedback! Unfortunately I don't think the VoIP.ms API would allow for that.

google_play_reviews.content: There is a bug in this app where if the message is too long it'll throw an error as opposed to breaking it up into multiple messages like a normal app would do. Everything else works like a dream. Can this bug be fixed please? Keep up the great work!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: It looks like I might be able to use the VoIP.ms ID to order messages correctly; this will be fixed in the next release.

google_play_reviews.content: Awesome app. Thanks for making it easier to get SMS from voip.ms.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your feedback!

google_play_reviews.content: This app is great, it makes the voip.ms number on my phone act like a first-class phone number (ie I can text back and forth with other folks who are not voip.ms customers and everything just works).  I really like the new look that came with the latest update.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your feedback!

google_play_reviews.content: Overall, this app is fantastic. Although I do have a minor annoyance. I use 3 numbers, but use one of them way more than the others. I can't figure out how to change the order of appearance for those numbers. My primary # is second on the list, so I have to select it each new text message. If I could change the order, I would place it at the top. Alternatively, having the option to turn off the number select altogether, and have it use whatever number the "tab" you're on is would be amazing.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hmm, that's odd. When I open the app, the DID selected is always the last DID I was using, not necessarily the DID at the top of the list. That's not the case for you?

google_play_reviews.content: Very pleased that I can now send & receive long messages that will be automatically split into multiple SMS texts. 2019-04-26 Update: still enjoying the app very much. One pain point, however, is that I sometimes accidentally scroll to the top of my SMS conversations list and accidentally initiate a 'refresh'. Apparently my many messages result in refresh actions over the next several hours or days. I would prefer to have the 'refresh' operation be less available to my accidental execution.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: You can shorten the length of a synchronization by changing your synchronization start date to a later date.

google_play_reviews.content: New UI looks fantastic, Michael, thank you! It is fitting that such a well built app look the part, as well.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your feedback!

google_play_reviews.content: A life saver app for those who rely solely on VoIP. MS for their day to day calls and don't want to purchase carrier SMS plans. The recent addition of Android Auto support makes it even better than before.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Glad you like the app!

google_play_reviews.content: great app allowing almost instand sms through Voip.ms. i just hope there is a material design redesign comig soon because the app is looking kind of dull. Great job. I would be willing to pay gor a pro version with more customization !

google_play_reviews.content: amazing app, hats off to the developer. love how to enable API IP Address outside of office or home wifi / mobile data i can just add 0.0.0.0 to allow any ip to aviod missing any text

google_play_reviews.content: works great

google_play_reviews.content: Pretty nice, seems to work well! Only issue is that my SMS are coming out of order... I'll send a message, then the reply will come above it, and then my text below my first... seems inconsistent as well. But, it works! So that's a pretty big plus.

google_play_reviews.content: It worked well then from September 8 notification stop working, both phones in my house have the same problem, very strange. we tried another app notification no problem. google_play_reviews.content: the best app. I rarely leave reviews but the maker deserves more than reviews. I've donated and suggest others should too as the maker wasn't gready and didnt introduce ads or buyable functions. I hope the sms service from voip.ms stays free

google_play_reviews.content: The sms app just works . Voip.ms has been awesome !

google_play_reviews.content: Now VoIP.ms is like real second provider here. Wish this app could handle standard SMS in dual-sim style. And message assembly/disassembly desperately needed, especially for Unicode (shortened) messages.

google_play_reviews.content: Great work guys , app works for me Samsung s9

google_play_reviews.content:
Great neat interface. It needs some bug fixing. Synchronization Start From 
Date seems to have no effect. Perfect for voip.ms texting. It would be nice 
to see some restrictions for voip.ms resale clients to only access their 
own DIDs, not all of DIDs.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
I've tested the "start from" setting and it seems to work correctly for me. Did you perform a manual synchronization by swiping down in the conversations view?

I'm not sure if the VoIP.ms API supports the resale client restrictions you're asking for. Do your clients have their own API credentials?

google_play_reviews.content: Work well, in the pas it was crashing in the background sometimes, but now it's really stable.  the "mark as read" from the notification is not working on my cell (SGS7 oreo).   Overall it's a really good app

google_play_reviews.content:
Great work Michael... I look forward to the continued development of the

use voip.ms service with zoiper soft phone, plus your beautiful app, I do 
not miss anything while travelling internationally. I am looking for 
forward to new updates, such as having multiple DID Glad that you are back 
Michael with this new update. You do great work. Thanks again for having 
our backs
google_play_reviews.replyContent: I'm glad you like the app! Multiple DID support was just added to the 0.5.0 release.

google_play_reviews.content:

google_play_reviews.replyContent: Notifications with sound work for me -- I suspect it's an issue with your phone.

google_play_reviews.content: Picture message is the only missing feature.

google_play_reviews.content: Great app, would recommend to any VoIP.ms user.

google_play_reviews.content: IF u get "Failed to retrieve DIDs An unknown error occurred" it's because your API password is not your login password

google_play_reviews.content: Works as advertised for me. I have push notifications enabled. I am a low volume user, so keep that in mind. Would definitely recommend you at least try this app if looking for a voip.ms SMS solution.

google_play_reviews.content: Love this app! Works great

google_play_reviews.content: Does not work. Tried three times to set the voip.ms API password on my account but this app fails to retrieve the numbers. "Failed to retrieve DIDs. An unknown error occured."
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Are you sure you are using the API password instead of your portal password? This information is in the Quick Start guide in the app's help.

google_play_reviews.content: Worked great in the past but now I'm getting an error: synchronization failed: voip.ms api returned error 'invalid_daterange'. Any ideas?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: This is a bug that should be fixed in the latest release. Please let me know if it's not!

google_play_reviews.content: Got the app running works great.  Just wondering if I'm missing something?   I get a noise and a vibe for notification, and it comes up on my screen quickly for 15 seconds as per settings.  I don't get a number on the app like you get on other apps telling me I've an unread message.  So I have to open the app when I've been away to see any messages that I have missed.  I've set the battery optimizations as well, so I was hoping this would work, but nothing.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Are you saying the notification disappears without you specifically interacting with it or dismissing it?

google_play_reviews.content: On my first attempt to log in I set it to fetch a few days of text history. I think it was timing out fetching this and I never got my DIDs loaded.  Today and changed to only fetch new and everything went smoothly. Looking forward to using this!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: This is a bug that should be fixed in the latest release. Please let me know if it's not!

google_play_reviews.content: Excellent app.  I have no SMS carrier and rely solely on this app to text with all my costumers for my business .it never fails. Absolutely love it,keep up the good work,make sure to donate people!!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your feedback!

google_play_reviews.content: Works great!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your feedback!

google_play_reviews.content: I've got Push notifications enabled, but I don't get texts pushed to me. Messed up. I've missed a whole bunch of messages because I have to open the app to actually get the notification alerts. What's the point of this app if you have to have the app constantly opened to receive your messages?
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
I suspect the issue is that synchronization sometimes takes so long that Android halts it prematurely and prevents the app from sending a notification. 

To prevent this, I've changed the message retrieval service into a foreground service in the latest release. Please give it a try and let me know if the problem is fixed.

google_play_reviews.content: The app now gets messages in realtime, and even supports multiple DIDs, both of which were issues I mentioned in a previous version of this review. I'm very happy this this app now; it can't get much better :) One small thing - when another app wants to send an SMS, it opens the system messenger, not this app :( So I have to manually go to this app when I want to send an SMS. An example of this is Google Maps, which allows you to share your trip progress via SMS. That's a feature I can't use for now because this app doesn't catch the intent from Google Maps.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: This problem has to do with the fact that VoIP.ms is not a "real" SMS app -- it can't send or receive carrier SMS messages, so Android refuses to treat it like an SMS app for intent purposes. Unfortunately there's nothing I can do about that, AFAIK :(

google_play_reviews.content: Setup was simple, functionality is perfect and I love that the design perfectly mimics the actual Android Messages app. Thank you for keeping this app alive!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your feedback!

google_play_reviews.content: Very responsive developer.  Makes VoIP SMS feature usable as daily driver. Be sure to donate.   Android Auto support would be even better. Like to donate more, but do not see a donate button anymore?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Android Auto support has been added. There's a donate button in the main menu -- it redirects to PayPal.

google_play_reviews.content: Excellent work! Is it difficult to implement? Would be neat if it could be integrated into some of the open source messaging tools like disa.im. Similarly, if it could get some kind of default status as the main sms tool (even if we don't plan to use regular sms).
google_play_reviews.replyContent: I think a disa.im plugin for VoIP.ms might not be a bad idea, but that would probably be its own project. Unfortunately VoIP.ms SMS cannot be set as the default messaging app on Android because it does not support carrier SMS messages.

google_play_reviews.content: It is as easy to use as the phone message. Thank you!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Glad you like the app!

google_play_reviews.content: Best way to send/receive SMS from Voip.ms. Easy to setup, and working really well. I like that the dev is constantly making it better. The only thing I'd like is the possibility to change de color of the LED for the notification of an incoming SMS. Thanks!!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: That functionality will be coming in Android O -- if any developer work is required to get it to work I'll worry about it then. Glad you like the app!

google_play_reviews.content: This works awesome since the most recent update on my note 4! Thanks.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Glad you like the app!

google_play_reviews.content: App works amazingly!  Recent updates from v0.50 and up have really made it more fluid and less buggy.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Glad you like the app!

google_play_reviews.content: Works wonders on my OnePlus 3!  Had to do the Battery Optimization trick (set to not optimize) for notifications to work correctly with the new update.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Glad you like the app!

google_play_reviews.content: You rock! Where do I donate?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: You can donate using PayPal -- here's a link: paypal.me/kourlas

google_play_reviews.content: Great app
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Glad you like the app!

google_play_reviews.content: App has improved a lot, and dev is very responsive and helpful, even adding commonly requested features. If you have a low end device (like me, <= 1GB RAM) I would recommend setting up email for notifications, as the push notifications in this app don't actually contain the messages, but just indicate to the app that it's time to sync with the server - so if the app cannot start for whatever reason, no notification comes through. Despite small problems, this app is still the best option for sending SMS through voip.ms, and it's completely free!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: I've tried to improve performance of push notifications by implementing a wake lock for the synchronization process -- hopefully correctly this time! You might try turning off battery optimizations as well, which is what another reviewer suggested. Glad you like the app!

google_play_reviews.content: Great update!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: This has to do with a timeout issue; I'll be adding the ability to configure the timeout in a future release.

google_play_reviews.content: This app is just incredible. With the voip.ms service, you can use this app to send and receive SMS messages the same way you would do so with a regular cell phone company. The app is always updated and the developer answers support requests really quickly.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Glad you like the app!

google_play_reviews.content: Good app that allows me to use Voip.ms SMS easily. But I have problems receiving texts at times. Some texts don't come through at all and others are cut off after about 100 characters. Not sure if it is a VoIP.ms problem or a problem with the application
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Unfortunately, that sounds like a VoIP.ms issue, though you might try the 0.5.0 release that just came out to see if the problem is fixed. Glad you like the app!

google_play_reviews.content: This is a great app. Make sure you put 0.0.0.0 as the IP address in your VoIP.ms settings so that you can text on your mobile network.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Glad you like the app! The "0.0.0.0" tip can also be found in the app's help menu.

google_play_reviews.content: Very useful app.  I am now able to have a data only plan.   What would make the app perfect would be if it could be setup as the default messaging app (not sure if it's possible) and if it could handle MMS (not supported by voip.ms)
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Unfortunately, it's not a real (carrier) SMS app so it can't be set as the default. It also can't support MMS until VoIP.ms adds support for MMS.

google_play_reviews.content: Works, love it. Can't thank the developer enough.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Glad you like the app!

google_play_reviews.content: Absolutely fantastic! Just what I was looking for and works great. Thank you.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Glad you like the app!

google_play_reviews.content: Great app! Works like a charm! You should also automatically activate the auto call back in the url callback option. It should resolve the problem of receiving messages when not connected.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: That shouldn't matter, actually -- the server is always online and FCM should take care of auto-delivering messages to offline devices. Glad you like the app!

google_play_reviews.content: Very useful app! There seems to be a delay when sending messages but great work nonetheless!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Unfortunately, that's an issue on VoIP.ms's end, not mine. Glad you like the app!

google_play_reviews.content: Good to go!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Glad you like the app!

google_play_reviews.content: Best-looking. Push notifications mostly working but wish it could be better. When it works, incoming text will wake phone, turning the screen on momentarily with audio cue and phone vibration. NextPlus as fast as 2 seconds, Freedom Mobile: 20 seconds.  Other times wait 1 minute, even 8 minutes, nothing.  Yet I can open home screen, wait 40 seconds and notification suddenly arrives.  Concerned about not so much fear of missing out so much as wasting time and money because a meeting location changed and I didn't get the text in time. Not consistent enough for me. Might be voip.ms beta SMS network problem, not app's fault. Leaving voip.ms service for now to switch to Fongo, its app can wake my phone within 5 seconds, every time. But if using voip.ms, I recommend voip.ms SMS.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: I suspect these issues have more to do with VoIP.ms than the app, but you might try updating to the 0.5.0 release to see if there's any improvement.

google_play_reviews.content: Perfect app. Unique in its kind.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Glad you like the app!

google_play_reviews.content: Really appreciate the support for VoIP.ms  Can you make this selectable as the default messaging app?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Unfortunately that's not possible, as Android will not allow an app to be set as the default SMS app unless it is capable of handling carrier SMS messages.

google_play_reviews.content: Thanks to the developer for all their hard work on this app. If you are considering switching to data only, this app (& voip.ms service) makes it possible. The only  improvements I can suggest are to: add a function to group several texts together, and add a longer timeout for the API response. Other than that it is perfect.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Both suggestions are on my to-do list.

google_play_reviews.content: This covers a big hole in terms of using sms with a VoIP setup. Thank you to the developer for putting this together. The interface is very simple but effective.

google_play_reviews.replyContent:
For the first issue, do you have push notifications enabled?

For the second issue, that might not be a problem with the app. Check the VoIP.ms message centre to see if you actually received the same message multiple times.

google_play_reviews.content: This app works well with voip.ms. The help was great in figuring out API password etc..  Any future plans to allow us to use as "default" sms messaging app on android would be great!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the feedback! That's a popular feature request, but sadly impossible because of how the Android default SMS feature works. VoIP.ms SMS would have to support regular SMS messages in order for Android to allow it to be set as the default SMS app.

google_play_reviews.content: Solid solution for using VoIP.ms SMS. Developer continues to update app. Make sure to donate.

google_play_reviews.content: Great app; is working perfectly. So far, the push notifications have been  immediate, same as native app.  Don't understand why voip.ms doesn't offer this as part of their basic service, really makes the VOIP package complete.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the positive feedback!

google_play_reviews.content: DID showing some error {Failed to retrieve DIDs. The VoIP.ms API returned the followig error: invalid_credentials. (203)} this is what i'm getting every time when i'm tapping the DID phone number
google_play_reviews.replyContent: That error message means that the VoIP.ms API is rejecting your credentials; it's not the app's fault. Are you sure you set an VoIP.ms API password? Note that this is not necessarily the same as your account password.

google_play_reviews.content: Not sure if this is because both DIDs I use are ports and not original VoIP.ms numbers, but my notifications are extremely unreliable on two different devices (both on Marshmallow). Comparing with Gmail notifications, they are very delayed and sometimes don't make it at all.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Unfortunately, it's difficult to fix notification problems due to their complexity. When you get an SMS, VoIP.ms sends a msg to a server I maintain. The server maintains a database matching DIDs with GCM reg IDs. When it receives a msg from VoIP.ms, it sends a message to Google telling them to push a GCM msg to your phone. Many things can go wrong!

google_play_reviews.content: This app is an exemple in extremely well executed app dev.  Functional, looks nice, fills a need, open source and has ZERO BLOAT!    There's only one feature which I feel is missing... and that is the option to define the app as the default SMS app. Making the SMS button in contacts open this app instead of the default messaging app.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: That's a popular feature request, but one that is impossible to implement without turning VoIP.ms into a fully fledged SMS app that can send and receive carrier SMSes. That's the only way Android will let an app respond to SMS requests from other apps such as Contacts. Thanks for the positive feedback, though!

google_play_reviews.content: Works brilliantly! No advertisements and fully functional. It would be a crime to not give the 1$ asked for in the hidden away donate button for such a great app.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the positive feedback!

google_play_reviews.content: Not a hard core texter but I do use it occasionally. Very much appreciate this app. Thanks. Donated again.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the positive feedback!

google_play_reviews.content: Great!  I don't like how I need to enable API access on voip.ms.  Seems less secure.  Any way I can add a proxy to this so I can get my messages via the same IP all  the time? (reducing how many IPs I need to add to my API permissions)  Otherwise, really good app.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: The VoIP.ms API is password restricted, so it's not significantly less secure then the actual web client. You might try using a VPN with a static IP address and only including that IP in the approved list of IPs.

google_play_reviews.content: Works great!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the positive feedback!

google_play_reviews.content: great looking, simple, and "just works".   only one request, add support for multi DID without having to switch in settings!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Multiple DID support is on my to-do list. Thanks for the positive feedback!

google_play_reviews.content: I first got this app and thought it was great. Every single time I try to use it now, it crashes on me before I can get a message out. :(
google_play_reviews.replyContent: I've fixed a number of bugs in the 0.4.2 release. Try it again, and if you still see issues, make sure to send a crash report so that I can investigate.

google_play_reviews.content: One fundamental flaw:  why would you only want to check for messages once a day?  If the push functionality doesn't work, why not make the option to force SMS checks more frequently like an email client?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: I've added additional sync intervals in the latest release.

google_play_reviews.content: Truly amazing app! With this app I feel like I could go with a data only plan now. I have tried in the past and sms always ruined it. Only thing I find missing is Android N style inline reply which is fair since it's still beta but hope it comes soon. Also may I suggest contacting the textra developer and maybe integrating with their app or some kind of a team up. They have a tonne of great features. But yeah this app is truly great and has come a long way from the initial release.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Please open an issue on GitHub for the inline reply feature. Thanks for the positive feedback!

google_play_reviews.content: Works great, super fast and reliable !
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the positive feedback!

google_play_reviews.content: I setup a data only plan and this is the perfect way to get SMS working on it. I gladly donated, keep up the great work!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the positive feedback!

google_play_reviews.content: Great app!  One suggestion (not sure if it's possible): can the app appear as an SMS app to Android so that the user can choose it as the default application for SMS? That way clicking 'sms' from within a contact would open this app instead of the system's SMS app.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: That's a popular feature request, but one that is impossible to implement without turning VoIP.ms into a fully fledged SMS app that can send and receive carrier SMSes. That's the only way Android will let an app respond to SMS requests from other apps such as Contacts. Thanks for the positive feedback, though!

google_play_reviews.content: App works as described. Easy to set up. Lightweight. Thanks.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the positive feedback!

google_play_reviews.content: Awesome

Seamless Android SMS integration. Feels almost exactly like the native messenger app and allows you to forget you're on voip vs traditional SMS. Works like a charm with helpful error messages and I love that it's open source! many thanks to the dev :) I would add functionality to automatically delete old messages, as well as display on the index page which conversations contain messages that had an error while sending.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Happy to say that the latter feature is in the latest 0.4.2 release! Can you open a GitHub issue for the former one? Thanks for the positive feedback!

google_play_reviews.content: You just made my user experience on using VOIPms better. I can now initiate my SMS. If you have a VOIPms account and you are using a mobile, well you definitely need this app.
Thanks for making this app. Gladly donated. One minor issue, the menu pop-up dialog has white on white text. It's a little harder to see the text, perhaps make the text black? Other wise all good.
Great app! Very clever way to handle push notifications. Easy to setup and very well laid out app. Keep up the good work.

This app has been great and reliable.  Does exactly what you expect it to do with the right minimum features.  I came to voip.ms from ring.to and the SMS capabilities of this app blow ring.to away.  Thank you for your work!

Love the app. As the others have stated, once you set the IP at 0.0.0.0 everything works just fine. One limitation though, cannot send same text to multiple contacts. Works fine in every other way on a Cyanogenmod 13 Samsung S4.  Thank you for a great app.
This app is amazing! I've been waiting for something like this. Works perfectly!
Works very well
Gives me SMS the way I want it. Feels native as with a carrier. Notifications and all. Thank you!
Fast, easy setup, simple layout. Donated!
Great app
Great!
Awesome app Michael, thank for doing this!
Very useful.
Works great and looks good doing it. Just remember to set the ip to 0.0.0.0 as mentioned in previous comments.
Works great once you figure out 0.0.0.0 works as an allowed IP for the API. Found out thanks to Matthew Raven's comment here.
works great. please make a ios version
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Unfortunately, I don't own a Mac so I can't develop for iOS. It also costs $99/year to maintain a developer account. :(

google_play_reviews.content: Problem with accent
google_play_reviews.replyContent: VoIP.ms intermittently supports non-alphanumeric characters in SMSes; this isn't a problem with the app but with them.

google_play_reviews.content: Great app. Took me awhile to read that the API IP needs to be 0.0.0.0 for this to be useful (it's in the Help menu, but I didn't look there right away). But after that change, it's smooth sailing!
Thank you!!!
Awesome!!!  Good work!
Great open source application. Dev is very responsive on github issue tracker. Can't wait until I can eventually respond through my Moto 360 (Android Wear)
Perfect.
Great app works as it should, clean layout. Push notification is instant, very helpful. I would have given 5 stars if emoticons were functional.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Unfortunately, VoIP.ms mangles any character in a text message that's not ASCII, including emoji and emoticons. It's up to them to fix this problem.

Thanks for your feedback!

google_play_reviews.content: Could use support for multiple DID, otherwise, seems solid.
New update is great.
Very slick
